name: China
sectors: Power (other sectors to be included later)
inclusion_thresholds: Entities with emissions of at least 26,000 tCO2 per year
emissions_cap: ~4,000 MtCO2 per year (2021) - based on sum of allocations of covered entities

name: South Korea
sectors: All sectors with entities above inclusion thresholds (power, industry, buildings, transport, waste and others)
ghgs: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs & SF6
inclusion_thresholds: Entities with emissions of at least 125,000 tCO2e per year, or with installations having emissions of at least 25,000 tCO2e per year
emissions_cap: 3048 MtCO2 across Phase 3 (5 years, 2021-2025) - absolute cap

name: Tokyo & Saitama
sectors: Consumption of fuels, heat and electricity in commercial and industrial buildings
inclusion_thresholds: Facilities consuming energy equivalent to at least 1,500 kl of crude oil per year
emissions_cap: 12 MtCO2 per year (Tokyo, 2020) & 7 Mt CO2 per year (Saitama, 2020) - actual emissions

name: Indonesia
inclusion_thresholds: Power plants with capacity more than 100MW
emissions_cap: ~159 MtCO2 per year  (2021) - based on sum of allocations of covered entities
notes: ETS development was mandated in the Government Regulation on Environmental Economic Instruments in 2017
ETS readiness has included MRV system development, policy development, capacity building and an ETS trial for coal power stations which started in 2021
The trial ETS is to familiarize stakeholders with an ETS, with a national ETS including more sectors planned to start by 2024.

name: Thailand
notes: A domestic carbon market was called for in the 12th National Economic and Social Development Plan (2017-2021) with details expected to be outlined in the Climate Change Act later in 2021
Since 2013 ETS development has taken place as part of a voluntary ETS
A pilot ETS will be implemented in the Eastern Economic Corridor as part of a strategic plan being developed in 2021

name: Taiwan
notes: The GHG Reduction and Management Act of 2015 signalled Taiwan EPA's intention to implement an ETS
ETS plans are further outlined in Climate Change Action Guideline of 2017 and GHG Reduction Action Plans
Taiwan EPA is currently amending the GHG Act to include details of carbon pricing policy - to be released later in 2021

name: Vietnam
notes: In 2020 a revised Law on Environmental Protection was adopted which mandates the design of a domestic ETS - this law will enter into force in January 2022
The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE) is set to establish the ETS
A pilot system is expected to start first, followed by a full system

name: Philippines
notes: A bill including provisions for a cap-and-trade system for industrial and commercial sectors was conditionally approved in 2020
A technical working group has been established to review the bill, which will be reconsidered based on the group's input
